goal.core.program.actions

Class Action

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.program.actions.Action
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExitModuleAction, LogAction, MentalAction, ModuleCallAction, PrintAction, UserSpecAction, UserSpecOrModuleCall

    public abstract class Action
extends ParsedObject
    Abstract class for the actions that a GOAL agent can perform.

    There are two types of actions: so-called built-in (also called reserved) actions and so-called user-specified actions. Adopting and dropping a goal, inserting and deleting beliefs, and sending a message are examples of built-in actions.

    By default, whenever an agent is connected to an environment, a user-specified action is sent to that environment for execution. A programmer can indicate using the "@int" option (inserted directly after the action name and parameters in the action specification) that an action should NOT be sent to an environment.

    Every action has a precondition and a postcondition. A precondition specifies the conditions that need to hold to be able to perform the action (successfully); a postcondition specifies the (expected) effects of the action. Only user-specified actions may have multiple action specifications, i.e., preconditions and corresponding postconditions.

    Author:
    K.Hindriks, N.Kraayenbrink #executeAction(MentalState, SteppingDebugger) now returns the executed action, and #getActionType() has been added. (19nov09)
    See Also:

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Checks whether this action is closed. An action is closed if none of its parameters have any occurrences of (free) variables.
        Returns:
        true if all parameters of the action are closed; false otherwise.

      • applySubst

        public abstract Action applySubst(Substitution substitution)
        Creates a new Action by applying the Substitution to it, i.e. by replacing any free variables in the action's parameters that also occur in the substitution by the corresponding terms.
        Parameters:
        substitution - The substitution to apply
        Returns:
        Instantiated action which is the result of applying the substitution to this action.

      • getPrecondition

        public abstract MentalStateCond getPrecondition(KRlanguage language)
                                         throws GOALParseException
        Returns the precondition for this Action. The action is applicable only if the MentalStateCond has at least one solution.

        Does not support multiple specifications for actions.

        Parameters:
        language - The KR language that is used for representing the action's precondition.
        Returns:
        A MentalStateCond that represents the action's precondition; or null if the precondition of the action does not depend on the agent's MentalState.
        Throws:
        GOALParseException - If a parser error is generated when constructing the the precondition of DeleteAction,

      • evaluatePrecondition

        protected abstract Action evaluatePrecondition(MentalState mentalState,
                          Debugger debugger,
                          boolean last)
        Checks whether the precondition of this Action holds and, if this is the case, returns the action selected for execution.
        Parameters:
        mentalState - The MentalState in which the precondition is evaluated.
        debugger - The current debugger
        last - If this is the last possible variation we are trying to execute, e.g. after this there are no more possibilities and the action will fail.
        Returns:
        The action that is selected for execution if the precondition holds; null otherwise.

      • run

        public final Result run(RunState<?> runState,
         Substitution substitution,
         Debugger debugger,
         boolean last)
        Performs the Action. First applies the given Substitution to the action and checks whether the precondition holds and the action is closed. If it is closed, the action is executed using #executeAction(RunState).
        Parameters:
        runState - The RunState in which the action is executed.
        substitution - The substitution provided by the action's context.
        debugger - the debugger to be used. #2813 we need this to handle calls from the IDE to execute actions. Normally you set this to RunState.getDebugger().
        last - If this is the last possible variation we are trying to execute, e.g. after this there are no more possibilities and the action will fail.
        Returns:
        The result of the action that was performed.
        Throws:
        GOALActionFailedException - If the action is not closed, action is internal but this is not indicated in the program, or other exeptions occurred.

      • executeAction

        protected abstract Result executeAction(RunState<?> runState,
                   Debugger debugger)
        Executes the Action.
        Parameters:
        runState - The RunState in which the action is executed.
        debugger - The current debugger.
        Returns:
        The action that has been executed; never returns null but throws runtime exceptions if executing the action fails.

      • report

        protected final void report(Debugger debugger)
        Reports that action was performed on either the channel for reporting built-in or user specified actions.
        Parameters:
        debugger - The current debugger.
